item.title: Works Barriers Left Behind, 26th January
item.description:
Hi Some large plastic works barriers have been left on the side of the pavement outside 25 and 27 Hampden avenue for weeks now. Please could they be picked up by the council?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampden Avenue, Elmers End, Greater London

item.title: Outside 24 Ellerdale Rd & also 18 Ellerdale Road, 26th January
item.description:
Street lights at junction of Ellerdale Rd & Prince Arthur Rd were removed last week (also light at 18 Ellerdale Rd). Are they to be replaced, because they worked before being removed & now the whole area is incredibly dark, which is not just a problem for us personally but also because the junction is quite busy.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Ellerdale Road, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Owners of house have put out fencing blocking pavement, 26th January
item.description:
The pavement has now been blocked for over 3 days despite phone calls to the Council. The owners of the house move the blockage when they take their cars off the drive, then put it back blocking the pavement. Children and parents going to and from school and Danson Park now have to walk in the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bean Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Our driveway access blocked by abandoned van, 26th January
item.description:
A van has parked outside our house blocking our driveway and we are unable to use our car. The van might be abandoned as it has been there for several hours now. We won’t be able to take our child to school tomorrow so currently this is a big issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodbastwick Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavings rising/collapsing, 26th January
item.description:

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Vehicle not moved, 26th January
item.description:
This van has been parked on our street for over 3 weeks without moving. It is taking up 2 car spaces. Our road has limited parking as it is and over the last few weeks I have to park away from home which is not ideal considering I have a health condition. We have been advised of a change of property round the corner and even though we all rejected it the proposal has gone ahead. Since then this van has turned up me not moved. I have seen a few men around giving me very horrible looks. I have a young boy and there are other children around too. I believe there is a chance they could be squatting in the property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penn Lane, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Freezer and furniture pile has been getting bigger since October, 26th January
item.description:
This rubbish has been here since Oct 2024. The gates used to belong to Co-Op milkyard but site has been sold for redevelopment. However, this is not due until 2028. Please could this rubbish be removed as more items arrive every week now. Thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bostall Lane, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left here., 26th January

item.title: Not moved for months, 26th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Great Harry Drive, Eltham
